str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
Artemas, a Christian in Rome. Contracted from a compound of Artemis and doron; gift of Artemis; Artemas, a Christian.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From a derivative of tugchano; fortuitous, i.e. Fortunate; Tychicus, a Christian.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Nicopolis, a city of Macedonia. From nikos and polis; victorious city; Nicopolis, a place in Macedonia.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
To pass the winter. From para and cheimazo; to winter near, i.e. Stay with over the rainy season.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
